Description: Gold amulet in the shape of a hollow bifrons wedjat-eye, pierced lengthwise, and made of several sheets of metal embossed and welded. A plait line marks the eyebrows.
Curator's comments: One of the gold "symbolic eyes" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, "hollow, sheet, same both sides, ribs soldered on", ibid., p. 110, pl. xli, 26. See also London, BM, EA 18269 and Boston, MFA 87.760.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 26)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.45, p.50, p.58-59, p.179, pl.21)
Exhibition history: Exhibired: 2019-2020 6 Jul–6 Jul, Wakefield Museum, Gateway to Eternity: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
